intro: Pyrethrum hissaricum, commonly known as the Hissar pyrethrum, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant produces fine, hair-like structures called trichomes, which contain pyrethrins—natural insecticides. Pyrethrum hissaricum thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for cultivation in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it valuable for both ornamental purposes and pest control applications.
